Recipe.title: Mashed Potatoes
Recipe.Description: Mashed potatoes is one of the easiest side-dishes to prepare. However, it is a little time consuming, so make sure to factor that in while preparing your meal.

section.instruction: Place Potatoes into a large saucepan or small pot.
Add enough Water to cover potatoes then add Salt.
Heat to a boil, and boil for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are soft.
Strain all water out, and place Potatoes and Butter into a bowl.
Using a potato masher, mash the potatoes until the Butter is melted and well mixed into the Potatoes.
Add Milk and stir until fluffy.

Notes.note: When available, you may use a hand mixer instead of a potato masher.

Modifications.modification: For thicker Mashed Potatoes, add less Milk. For less thick, add more.
The more you mash (or mix) the Potatoes, the smoother the Mashed Potatoes will be. The less, the chunkier.
